reference.title: euca-describe-dhcp-options
reference.shortdesc: Shows information about VPC DHCP option sets.

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: euca-describe-dhcp-options [--show-empty-fields] [-U URL] [--region USER@REGION] [-I KEY_ID] [-S KEY] [--security-token TOKEN] [--filter NAME=VALUE] [--debug] [--debugger] [--version] [-h] [dhcp_option_id [dhcp_option_id ...]]

row.entry: Limit results to one or more supplied dhcp option set IDs.

section.title: Available Filters
section.p: You can add filters to your request so that the response includes information for only certain DHCP option sets. For example, you can use a filter to return only the DHCP option set that has a specific ID. Some tips for using filters with this command:

ul.li: You can use multiple values for a filter. Eucalyptus responds with information for a DHCP option set only if it matches at least one of the filter values that you specified.

You can use multiple filters. For example, you can specify DHCP option sets that have a specific tag. Eucalyptus responds with the information for a DHCP option set only if it matches all the filters that you specified. If there is no match, Eucalyptus returns an empty response.

You can use wildcards in a filter value. Use an asterisk (*) to match zero or more characters. Use a question mark (?) to match exactly one character. To escape special characters, use a backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*eucalyptus\?\\ searches for the literal string *eucalyptus?\.

section.p: The following are the available filters for euca-describe-dhcp-options:

row.entry: key of a tag assigned to the DHCP option set
value of a tag assigned to the DHCP option set
type of the DHCP option set

section.title: Example
section.p: The following example describes all DHCP option sets for an account.
This command will return output similar to the following:
section.codeblock: DHCPOPTIONS dopt-4db27ac1 OPTION domain-name-servers AmazonProvidedDNS OPTION domain-name example.internal
